results.title: The Edge of forever
results.creator_credit: David F. Oyster, Gregory Andorfer, Adrian Malone, BBC Film Unit, Carl Sagan Productions, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Polytel International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
What is the origin of the universe? What is its fate? Will it continue to expand forever, or someday collapse upon itself? Carl Sagan explores the time when stars and galaxies began to form, and shows how, in this century, humans discovered the expansion of the universe. He also explores the philosophical and religious questions that these musings create. Topics discussed along the way include galaxies and their many different forms, the Doppler effect, tessaracts, the Big Bang and quasars.

results.title: Cosmos: a personal voyage
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Rob McCain, Adrian Malone, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Polytel
results.brief_description: Carl Sagan hosts this series of films which explore the mysteries of the universe and the origins of life.

constellations_other.name: A brief history of black holes on-screen
constellations_other.description: In 1916, Albert Einstein predicted black holes through his theory of general relativity. That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast’s Distortions in Spacetime. These other works are fascinated by these cosmic giants and represent an evolution in computer graphics and VFX.

constellations_other.name: Future You
constellations_other.description: There are 47,000 possible variations of robot in Future You. There's probably not that many in all of screen culture, but these ones stand out.

results.title: The Edge of the barrens
results.creator_credit: Dalton Muir, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A distinguished film study of the tundra of Canada’s sub-Arctic. It stretches from the polar sea to the southern treeline and supports, despite the permafrost, a surprising variety of life. Here you see the ungainly musk-ox, survivor of the Ice Age, and herds of caribou following the migrant trails; also birds and flowers, smaller animals, and insects. (Awards: Venice; Buenos Aires; Yorkton)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dalton Muir, Hugh O’Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Emperor's new groove
results.creator_credit: Mark Dindal, Randy Fullmer and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Emperor Kuzco is an arrogant and selfish leader and his latest plan involves destroying a hill top village to build a summer palace. He invites village elder Pancha in to discuss options, but only to find out the best place to get the sun. When the amnesiac emperor awakes to find himself turned into a llama, he blames the kindly Pancho, unaware that his conniving advisor, the wizened Yzma, and brawny brainless sidekick Kronk, have usurped his power. Demanding he be returned to the palace, Kuzco pushes Pancha’s faith that to the limit that all human beings possess goodness. Featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt, Patrick Warburton, Wendie Malick and music by Tom Jones and Sting, this witty Disney animation espouses the virtues of friendship and kindness to others.

group_works.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
group_works.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.
results.title_for_label: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.
